column4: this bug relates to your issue I believe:  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/alsa-driver/+bug/212960
if you like, you can pastebin the output of   dmesg
here is my dmesg http://paste.ubuntu.com/9411/
seems to be having an issue with your network card driver
doesn't look like a very happy  dmesg  at all :(
should i remove the network card and try to install hal again?
try to install    linux-ubuntu-modules
check out those launchpad bugs I listed for possible fixes
is said: "linux-ubuntu-modules-2.6.24-16-generic is already the newest version" I guess it is already installed?
sounds like it, yeah.  Maybe a re-install of those. (but not sure that will work or help)
I'm assuming you upgraded?
yes I upgraded
*nods*
seen lots of upgrades go bad unfortunately
you think a fresh install might fix it?
90% sure :)
go the Alternate CD if you plan do download a CD
only problem is i don't have a cd-burner. :(
check out that first link first
there are ways to do it without burning
If I am going to reinstall how can I get a list of all the packages I currently have intsalled?
maybe    apt-cache showpkg
ignore my command, go with zvacet's :)
